name: Athenagoras of Athens
summary: Athenagoras of Athens was a Christian apologist who lived during the second half of the 2nd century. He was a philosopher who converted to Christianity and wrote two important works: 'A Plea for the Christians' addressed to the Roman emperors Marcus Aurelius and Commodus, and 'On the Resurrection of the Dead.' His writings are characterized by their philosophical sophistication and defense of Christian beliefs against pagan accusations.

writings.title: On the Resurrection of the Dead
